intro: Canthium caudatiflorum, commonly known as the long-flowered spurred cucumber, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its distinctive spurred flowers and hairy stems. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in humid environments with well-drained soil. The plant produces small, green fruits that mature into yellow or orange berries. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical study and ecological research.
